description.person_1: Female doctor, mid-40s, Indian, wearing a white saree, speaking with open hands; professional expression

description.person_2_and_3: Silhouetted man and woman in an intimate pose in the large faded background image behind the doctor; appear to be adults

main_objects_props_featured: A circled image of interlocked hands (bearing subtle intimacy and support)
Background image of a couple (implied intimacy)
VISUAL ELEMENTS.background_environment: Soft, blurred image of a couple in an intimate embrace; predominantly neutral and slightly desaturated for contrast

THEMATIC ELEMENTS.overall_emotional_tone: Professional, empathetic, informative with approachable visual cues
visual_metaphors_or_symbols: Background couple to infer romantic/sexual context
clickbait_techniques_employed: Direct question implying problem-solving (why does sex hurt?)
Use of expert authority and professional branding

visual_reinforcement: Visual of doctor reinforces expert/medical aspect in the title
Text directly poses the same question as title (about pain during sex)
Lubricant benefit subtitle and caring hands visually align with the solution offered in the title
contrasts_or_mismatches: Thumbnail balances sensitivity (no explicit visuals) despite the potentially taboo or sensitive title topic
Tone remains clinical rather than sensationalistic, suitable for an educational/medical theme
